abstract: A year after accepting two taxpayer bailouts, Citigroup is racing to raise billions of dollars in the stock market to repay the aid, a crucial step in freeing itself from Washington’s grip.
snippet: A year after accepting two taxpayer bailouts, Citigroup is racing to raise billions of dollars in the stock market to repay the aid, a crucial step in freeing itself from Washington’s grip.
lead_paragraph: A year after accepting two taxpayer bailouts, Citigroup is racing to raise billions of dollars in the stock market to repay the aid, a crucial step in freeing itself from Washington’s grip.

headline.main: Citi Is Eager to Pay Back Bailout Aid

abstract: Bank of America fully repaid the U.S. government the $45 billion in aid it took during the height of the financial crisis, the company said on Wednesday.
snippet: Bank of America fully repaid the U.S. government the $45 billion in aid it took during the height of the financial crisis, the company said on Wednesday.
lead_paragraph: Bank of America has fully repaid the government the $45 billion in aid it took during the height of the financial crisis, the company said Wednesday.

headline.main: Bank of America Finishes TARP Repayment

abstract: The United States economy is struggling against “headwinds” that mean the government must retain the ability to respond to unexpected crises, even as it starts to wind down emergency programs, Treasury Secretary Timothy F. Geithner said Thursday.
snippet: The United States economy is struggling against “headwinds” that mean the government must retain the ability to respond to unexpected crises, even as it starts to wind down emergency programs, Treasury Secretary Timothy F. Geithner said Thursday.
lead_paragraph: The United States economy is struggling against “headwinds” that mean the government must retain the ability to respond to unexpected crises, even as it starts to wind down emergency programs, Treasury Secretary Timothy F. Geithner said Thursday.

headline.main: Geithner Sees ‘Headwinds’ on Road to Recovery
